intro: Monsonia alexandraensis, commonly known as Alexandra's monsonia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, evergreen leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
